fields.headline: The greatest thing …
fields.bodyText: While I endorse Waldemar Januszczak's appreciation of Eusébio's skills (Letters, 8 June), that is not the full story of the Benfica and Portugal man's greatness. The record states that Manchester United beat Benfica 4-1 in the 1968 European Cup final. What is not on record is that Eusébio was through on goal towards the end of 90 minutes with the score at 1-1. Only a save by Alex Stepney denied him. Eusébio applauded the keeper. Sportsmanship like that in the next few weeks in South Africa would indeed qualify the relevant player or players for the label of greatness that Eusébio enjoys in my mind's eye. Steve Till Alresford, Hampshire • Mike Marqusee writes for those who are not England supporters (Comment, 8 June). I'm bemused by the number of people who insist on informing everyone they support England by flying flags from cars here, not that far from the middle of … well, England. Surely there must be someone round here who hails from, well – New Zealand, South Africa or Nigeria, say. Let's see their flags. Anyway, England has already won one World Cup this year. How many do people want? John Emms Huddersfield, West Yorkshire • I have just been perusing the government's Spending Review Framework. It is good to know that in an ever-changing world some things are stable – the document has been "Printed in the UK by The Stationary [sic] Office Limited". Sydney Clayton Manchester • If Asda sliced bread is seen as a treat for a British expat living in Perigueux (Report, 9 June), what other British delicacies can Guardian readers suggest I, a Frenchman living in Sheffield, try? Laurent Bouillot Sheffield • Wales has two national theatres – one in Welsh, one in English. Perhaps Scotland could have three – English, Scots and Gaelic – to reflect the multilingual nature of Scottish society (Response, 9 June). Liam Physick Liverpool • Hellas, I hoped the Serres of Greek letters were over (Letters, 8 June), but it Piraeus Thera Pylos more to come. Steven Thomson London
